snippet.title: List of national parks of the United States - Wikipedia, the ...
snippet.description: The United States has 59 protected areas known as national parks, which are operated by the National Park Service, an agency of the Department of the Interior. National parks must be established by an act of the United States Congress. The first national park, Yellowstone, was signed into law by ...

snippet.title: Natural Parks and American Cities | Adrian Benepe
snippet.description: As we pause for a moment to remember Earth Day, the April 22 date which is America's un-official "green" holiday, I've been thinking about a fact I recently learned which surprised me, even though I've spent most of my adult life working in and around city parks. snippet.title: National Parks \- Welcome to the U.S. National Park Net
snippet.description: Welcome to the US National Parks site. This site is dedicated to providing information on all US national parks. Whether you seek to camp in Big Meadows of Shenandoah National Park, or take in the peaks of Great Smoky Mountains National Park, this site has what you need.

snippet.title: Natural Parks Define American Cities | The Nature of Cities
snippet.description: For readers wondering how America's biggest cities — some of them very densely populated and developed — have so much natural land within their borders, ... Spacious natural parks also dominate in cities with large populations as well as in those not as densely populated.
